name: Parador de Nerja

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont go to the Parador at Nerja. We want to keep the numbers down so we can go again next year!
reviews.title: Dont go!!!!

likes.liked: — the setting and the general quality of the hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Beautifully situated on the cliffs above Burrianna Beach and close to the Balcon and town centre this is just an excellent location. The rooms are well appointed and most have balconies looking out over the gardens to the beach below and the sea beyond.
reviews.title: The Parador de Nerja Only one complaint!

likes.liked: — Spacious lawns ensuring privacy amongst sunbathing guests

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The gardens are spacious with plenty of sunbeds and a good pool area.
reviews.title: Excellent all round

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007
reviews.text: The food deal is very good value for breakfast and fine for lunch or dinner but not everyday. There is more variety and good value in Nerja itself. The little cafe on the street corner 50 yards away is great value for drinks and snacks.
reviews.title: You may prefer Hotel Carbeo instead

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel staff are predominately Spanish speakers only and the service is good if a little leisurely at times.
reviews.title: Parador Pardise

likes.liked: — The grounds with the trees, flowers, pool, view, and outdoor bar.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have stayed at this Parador many times with my wife and in all seasons - latest time was in July 2011The parador is situated on a cliff over the Playa Burriana. There is a lift from the hotel to the beach. The hotel has a pool and is surrounded by nice well maintained gardens which are excellent for sunbathing. Meals are served on the terrace in the open air in summer. We normally only staya t the hotel for the very excellent breakfast. This is not a reflection on the hotel food. There are just too many other options locally. Playa Burriana is lined with beach restaurants serving excellent barbecued fish, seafood and Paella while the centre of Nerja (less than 10 minutes walk) offers many dining options.Rooms at the Parador are relatively large and all have sea view, balcony and nice bathroom. For a nightcap try the Bar Trebol on the corner on the rounabout at the entrance to the Parador.
reviews.title: Excellent location overlooking the Med

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011
reviews.text: Stayed for 6 nights. Wonderful views, pool and gardens. Rooms fine and staff helpful. Breakfast exceptional.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a lovely short 3 night stay. Peace and tranquility. Lovely pool. Lots of space in the garden to arrange your lounger. Great breakfast overlooking the sea from the terrace restaurant. Good choice as long as you don t crave a real English. Fab fresh fruit including bowls of cherries. Quiet well equipped rooms - I think most must have the sea view . Good blackout curtains so you think its early when its not..We did nt pay extra and had a great view.
reviews.title: Lived up to my expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Yes the staff are a little unfriendly in the restaurant and bar, aloof and difficult to attract attenttion at times. But this was minor.Reception were helpful, free parking mostly in the shade free safe. They do pour a mean G n T !
reviews.title: Average hotel, fabulous location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lift to the beach is good and a bonus and were requested a key after checkout so we could take a last stroll before we left for the airport. No problem
reviews.title: Beautiful setting for restful stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: great hotel great views but most important.. only a short walk to nerjas best curry house the JAIPOUR ..less than 5 min walk
reviews.title: ideal location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed in room 233, which is at the end of a hallway. Because of this our room was larger than most rooms as it incorporated the space of the hallway into the room itself. It was a great room, very spacious. In addition to chairs there was also a small sleeper sofa in the room. We had a balcony with a great view. The bathroom was big. There was plenty of storage.
reviews.title: Great Beach Views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a good sized pool and beautiful grounds. There is an elevator (operated by your room key) which will take you the several floors to and from the beach. The beach is beautiful.
reviews.title: Great place but could do better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There is a breakfast buffet which tends to be pricey but has all the things you expect to find on a breakfast buffet. It was our experience that all service related to food and drinks was slow, sometimes very slow no matter which meal you were dealing with.
reviews.title: Great Parador overlooking the sea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cons: Our balcony had a great ocean view however, you also had a great view into the balconies of the rooms below you unless they had their awnings extended, which meant that they also could look up at you on your balcony. Not a huge problem just strange.
reviews.title: Great location, great facilities but don't go during fiesta

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visited the Parador for a short holiday. Although the building does not look like an ancient Spanish castle as the typical Paradores do, but more like a modern apartment building, we were pleasantly surprised. The initial contact at the reception was somehow reserved, but the same people became very friendly and attentive later on. All staff were very friendly, housekeeping excellent. The room was functional, very clean, and had a balcony with a beautiful sea view. All rooms have sea view. It was quiet, except that on the east side there are some emissions from nearby bars, they close around midnight. There is no ironing board nor a coffee maker/kettle in the room, beds are comfortable, television has a great variety of channels, including cnn and bbc, air-conditioning. A bit annoying are the small portion soft drinks in the minibar, all 2 dl bottles, if you are thirsty, the minibar is empty pretty soon. It was a smoking room, much appreciated even though I preferred to smoke on the balcony. A real highlight was the breakfast, with all kind of warm dishes and a great variety of fruit, bread, cold meat, cheese, etc. It's one of the best breakfast buffets I've seen in Europe. As the weather was warm and sunny , we could sit on the terrace and enjoy the sea view. There is a nice and well groomed garden with interesting species of trees I had never seen before. The swimming pool was closed for maintenance, a pity, because the sea was not very warm (about 17 C). Beach by the way very clean and water transparent. The lift/elevator to the Burriana beach is spectacular. From the hotel a nice ten minute walk through typical Andalusian lanes takes you to the centre of Nerja with the famous Balcon de Europa. Other upsides are free internet in the lobby, and reception orders priceworthy taxis (e.g. only 70 euros to Malaga Airport). To conclude, I highly recommend this place to stay in Nerja.
reviews.title: Top Place to Relax in Nerja
Still great
reviews.text: Second time my wife and I have stayed here, having stayed previously in May. A bit quieter this time round, which was to be expected. The best bits are the wonderful breakfasts which you can eat out on the veranda overlooking the sea, and the views.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms have everything you need, and all seem to have a sea view.
reviews.title: Magnificent views of the Mediterranean

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We eat in the restaurant on the Saturday night, and had a wonderful meal, which we finished off with a coffee in the lounge where a piano player was performing.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel brilliant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dinks in the bar were very reasonable. We did not eat in on the Sunday as to be honest the place was dead, so instead eat out in the town centre which is a 5 minute walk away.
reviews.title: A pleasure to stay here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third Parador in almost as many days and the most enjoyable. It's spectacular setting above the beach is wonderful and the lift down makes you feel that you're staying somewhere a little special. The buiding itself is nothing remarkable, modern and functional, but that doesn't matter here. A lovely room with balcony overlooking the garden. Very comfortable and roomy with good bathroom. The staff were the most friendly we encountered and the restaurant was also good. The evening meal gave plenty of choice but breakfast was the best; an enormous variety of everything you could possibly want. You wouldn't need to eat again until the evening! The gardens around the pool make for very pleasant surroundings (the pool was closed, I'm not sure why as the weather was more than warm enough) but we weren't there long enough for that to be a problem. I'd certainly go back to this parador again, it was also extremely good value.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Beautifully situated in a characterful, delightful town. Balcony rooms overlooking the sea and pool are comfortable and relaxing. Bar and restaurant are great with excellent breakfasts. Staff friendly and attentive. Convenient for visits to Malaga and the west as well as Granada to the North.
reviews.title: A lovely autumn break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location is great...right next to the beach with an elevator to transport you from the hotel to beach level.
reviews.title: Ok but definitely NOT 4-star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself had a balcony with a view of the water which was nice. The room did have an odd odour to it though. This may not bother you and it may not have been a hotel-wide issue so I won't focus on it. Overall though we felt the cleanliness of the room did not live up to what we would expect from a hotel charging this much and claiming a 4-star (plus) rating. We arrived to find a shower/bathroom tile growing a lot of mould. Obviously if the washroom had be cleaned well and routinely we wouldn't expect to see mould....and not just a little....enough we could easily scrape off (have the pictures to prove it).
reviews.title: wonderful place to switch off and relax

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Also, we discovered expired milk products being served at the restaurant (several weeks expired). This was brought to the attention of the desk staff who assured us it was a "mistake" and would be dealt with. Unfortunately however the same expired products were still there the next day. Doesn't instill much confidence in management/staff and quality of the place. What other corners are being cut?
reviews.title: unexpectedly pleasant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No coffee maker or clock in the room.
reviews.title: Best location in Nerja area, wonderful views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent hotel in a perfect location. Plenty of space for parking, plenty of sun loungers in large beautifully kept gardens - with plenty of space between the loungers.
reviews.title: An Excellent Hotel - A Perfect Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great pool, big enough to swim around in.
reviews.title: Friendly, high quality

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Friendly and helpful staff. Fantastic breakfast.
reviews.title: Just Perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Unlike previous comments, I didn't find the hotel rundown at all. Large rooms, immaculately kept clean, big bathroom with separate room for the WC.
reviews.title: Best location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Best of all is the lift to take you down to the beach - I could really get used to living like this!!
reviews.title: "oh, it's lovely at the top!"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had to pull ourselves away after two nights at this lovely parador. Double room was huge with ok bedding and a great shower. AC was not working while we were there, but there was no noise from outside so opening the window worked fine. Views to the beach are amazing. Enjoy them from your balcony chairs or from the lovely pool, lawn, and beach (hotel provides an elevator down to the sand). Breakfast was outstanding - every hot and cold option you can think of and as much as you want with ocean views from the veranda! Staff was fantastic - housekeeping is spotless and reception had terrific suggestions on bars and restaurants away from the tourist haunts. You also get free parking and free high-speed internet. Easy walk to the city center and a short drive from the caves and a number of great beach hikes. One note of caution - as with many hotels in Spain, there was noise at night from the room above us. Bring your ear plugs.
reviews.title: Great views and breakfast, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Happy travels!
reviews.title: A Wonderful Oasis on Spain's overcrowded coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: We stayed here after a hectic and very enjoyable three day birthday party in the hills near Granada, so what we were looking for was peace and quiet and sunshine - and that's exactly what we got. Nerja is in danger of being overwhelmed by tourism but the parador has its own quiet space. It feels like an ocean liner that has just had a major refit. The rooms are good, with a decent size balcony and big bathroom. The dining room has a terrace which in April, was just right for eating breakfast on. The menu makes clear that you could spend a lot of money on meals but breakfast was included and we ate well off the snack menu for lunch (about £30, given the falling pound, for the two of us eating one course and having a beer). Big swimming pool and well kept grass around it. There was a lift down to the beach, but if you want the beach then you have to accept all the tacky stuff that goes with it.
reviews.title: A little disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check out was a bit difficult because the bill was divided into several different parts and it just took time to match it against the price we had been quoted. If you want a lot of action I wouldnt go here but if you want good service in a very good hotel (and you can find the right rate- the pricing seems to vary) then I think it's a great place to stay.
reviews.title: Excellent stay

likes.liked: — Great location, great views, relaxed sophistication

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For people who stay in Paradors regularly, this hotel is at the poor end of the Parador spectrum.
reviews.title: Good Hotel, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you stay in a hotel in Spain, Paradores is a guarantee. I spent a weekend with my husband there. Rooms are ok, with comfi beds and lovely sea views(ask for the highest floor(.
reviews.title: Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: LOCATION
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Lovely Gardens

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011
reviews.text: The best thing about this hotel are its views, it´s located on a small hill overlooking Burriana Beach with a lift that will take you to the beach.
reviews.title: The best reason to come to Nerja

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This area is full of chiringuitos (Spanish restaurants on the beach) and you can eat typical paella or boquerones (Malaga´s typical fish).
reviews.title: Best place to stay in Nerja

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I rented a car in Barcelona and drove down the coast in Spain. Our final destination war the Parador in Nerja. It was the most fabulous place we've ever stayed. We have stayed at many four and five star places in the US, including the Carribean and Mexico. I wish Nerja was closer so we could visit more often. Our room with terrace went right out to the lawn right to the pool. It is on a cliff where you can take an elevator to the beach. The beach has many bars/restraunts to enjoy that are more relaxing than the Parador which is a little stuffy (although you can order drinks and take to the pool). Five minute walk to town. Definitely the best place to stay in Nerja. I can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: Paradors never fail

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Paradors are usually well signposted, but if there is a prize for parador signposting, this one deserves it. Every exit of every roundabout from the outskirts of Nerja is very clearly marked.
reviews.title: Well signposted

likes.liked: — Views of the sea and coastline
likes.disliked: — Food at dinner was below normal Parador standard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007
reviews.text: The exterior appearance of the building, is, perhaps, unprepossessing, but once through the doors there is a delightful little cloistered garden which raises the spirits and makes you feel at home. The gardens are beautifully tended throughout, and disabled access to the lift to the beach appears to be in the course of construction. (We wondered what the disabled will do with the steps at the bottom on leaving the lift, however.)
reviews.title: Great Place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights in this Parador in a superior room, and needing simply to relax, soak in some sunshine and enjoy the delights of Creation from a large and relatively private balcony, it would be harder to find anywhere better.
reviews.title: Wonderful views, but in need of some modernisation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The building has clearly been refurbished recently and is light and airy, although aspects of the design work are perhaps a little idiosyncratic to middle-aged tastes.
reviews.title: Completely satisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place, nice hotel, modernistic but elegant in its way. Super terrace for really marvellous and horrifying abundant breakfast or honest lunch or dinner. But above all a really nice garden with swimming pool, overlooking Nerja's largest beach and the mediterranean. With a cool and superb direct elevator to the beach! We went there for our reading holiday (half of the suitcase filled with books) and this parador perfectly suited our needs. The seabreeze also makes the Andalusian summer temperatures ... comfortable.
reviews.title: on the balcony of Andalucia

description: The hotel is on a cliff overlooking the sea, in an ideal spot to enjoy the beach, which is reached by a singular lift; the coastline and the lovely natural landscape of the area. The entrance to the building boasts a splendid garden whose greenery contrasts with the blue of the pool. The spacious, light-filled interiors are comfortably furnished. All the rooms in the hotel have large terraces looking onto the sea (except basic rooms). The upper rooms also enjoy spectacular views over the Mediterranean and the mountains of the Sierra Almijara, and the beautiful cliffs of this rustic Malaga coast.
